item.title: WordCloud
item.description: To start working with Wordcloud and we need some words to create a wordcloud. I picked up one of the novels of Charles Dickens - Tale of Two Cities. The book is available to download from gutenbergr package. Install and bring the following libraries to your workspace. gutenbergr : The gutenbergr package helps you download and process public domain works from the Project Gutenberg collection. Metadata for all Project Gutenberg works as R datasets, so that they can be searched and filtered

item.title: flexdashboard
item.description: How to create a flexdashboar using Rstudio First we’ll import libraries needed . library(devtools) library(dplyr) # For data manipulation library(ggplot2) # For our graphs library(Lahman) library(knitr) library(flexdashboard) In the menu bar click, File - New File - R Markdown - From Template -Flexdashboard You will be presented with a file similar to this And you can insert your code chunks as you wish. Let’s get started with text mining.

item.title: Graphs in R
item.description: Let’s start by importing the libraries we will need to plot a graph. We would need dplyr to do the data manipulations Lahman to get the data about all the baseball players for our plots And lastly, ggplot2 and ggiraph are needed for the graphs. library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(Lahman) library(ggiraph) Now that we have our libraries/packages, Let’s do some data maipulation using dplyr We will search for all the players who have homeruns more than 400 in their careers.
